com.joliciel.talismane.parser

Class DependencyNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.joliciel.talismane.parser.DependencyNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<DependencyNode>

    public class DependencyNode
extends Object
implements Comparable<DependencyNode>
    A node inside a dependency tree.
    Author:
    Assaf Urieli

      In French, for example, a preposition and its object would thus be a single layer of depth, equivalent to a single adjective when modifying a noun.

      • addDependent

        public DependencyNode addDependent(PosTaggedToken dependent)
        Add an existing dependent of the current node's token to the current dependency node. The dependent must already exist in the parse configuration. This is useful for constructing sub-trees out of the existing parse tree.

      • addDependent

      • getDepth

        public int getDepth()
        Return the depth of this tree starting at its head (1).

      • getPerceivedDepth

        public int getPerceivedDepth(Set<String> zeroDepthLabels)
        Language-specific depth as a typical user would expect to see it.
        In French, for example, a preposition and its object would thus be a single layer of depth, equivalent to a single adjective when modifying a noun. A determinent would not add to its governor's depth.
        Parameters:
        zeroDepthLabels - labels which shouldn't be counted for depth calculation

      • removeNode

        public boolean removeNode(DependencyNode node)
        Removes a node (and all of its children) from this dependency node's tree, wherever it may be located.
        Returns:
        true if the node was removed.

      • getFirstToken

        public PosTaggedToken getFirstToken()
        The first token comprising this dependency node, if viewed in linear order within a sentence.

      • getLastToken

        public PosTaggedToken getLastToken()
        The last token comprising this dependency node, if viewed in linear order within a sentence.

      • isContiguous

        public boolean isContiguous()
        Return true if this node is contiguous, false if it contains gaps.
